intro: Chloroleucon guantanamense, commonly known as the Guantánamo dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting to the tropical climate. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing sandy soils.
